info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 06 at 9:23PM CDT until August 06 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Marion County in south central Illinois... * Until 1030 PM CDT. * At 923 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Boulder, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Salem, Centralia, Sandoval, Odin, Patoka, Omega, Fairman, Tonti, Iuka, Junction City, Alma, Cartter, Selmaville, and Brubaker. This includes Interstate 57 in Illinois between exits 116 and 127. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for south central Illinois.
